title: Rajko Ostojić
text:
Rajko Ostojić (; born 19 February 1962) is a Croatian physician and politician. A member of the <a href="Social%20Democratic%20Party%20of%20Croatia">Social Democratic Party</a> (SDP), he has been serving as Deputy Speaker of the <a href="Croatian%20Parliament">Croatian Parliament</a>. 
Ostojić graduated from the <a href="School%20of%20Medicine%2C%20University%20of%20Zagreb">School of Medicine</a> at the <a href="University%20of%20Zagreb">University of Zagreb</a> and specialised gastroenterology and hepatology.
He first became involved in politics in 2000 when he was appointed assistant to health minister <a href="Ana%20Stavljeni%C4%87-Rukavina">Ana Stavljenić-Rukavina</a>, and later served a term in the <a href="Members%20of%20the%206th%20Sabor">6th Sabor assembly</a> from 2008 to 2011. Following the <a href="2011%20Croatian%20parliamentary%20election">November 2011 election</a> won by the centre-left <a href="Kukuriku%20coalition">Kukuriku coalition</a> Ostojić became Croatia's Health Minister in the <a href="Cabinet%20of%20Zoran%20Milanovi%C4%87">cabinet</a> of <a href="Zoran%20Milanovi%C4%87">Zoran Milanović</a> in December that year.
